Keywords: Circus of Crime , Enforcers , Frightful Four , Monster , Mystical , Negative Zone , Robot
Real Name: N/A
Special Powers
FRIGHTFUL FOUR: PROPERTY DAMAGE: Friendly characters with the Frightful Four keyword have "FREE: If this character is adjacent to a printed square of blocking terrain, generate a light object."
MYSTICAL BREATH AND MORE: Energy Explosion, Penetrating/Psychic Blast, Super Strength.
RECHARGE THE BATTERIES: Invulnerability. FREE: Heal Dragon Man equal to the number of adjacent squares of printed blocking terrain, then destroy that terrain.

February 24, 2021
Goop
I love it when figures have EE and Psyblast, it gives options. Really his best ability is that heal at the end. "I'm gonna use my giant size to break away and move here, i'll free action to break these 5 walls and heal for 5." WTF?!?! So if you can get map choice this guy can be a beast.
July 30, 2020
CoolJerk
Dragon Man is a favorite character of mine, ever since FF 35. Saddened that this sculpt isn’t larger (especially obvious because he’s standing on a rock, bringing his overall height that much shorter), though in his first appearance he wasn’t overly large, either.

Sculpt is a little disappointing for a giant but at least he won't be so fall over prone like last time.

[B][COLOR="Sienna"]Pretty sure rule of 3 only applies to stats, and giant reach would not apply as that is for attacks, not actual adjacent squares. So he could, in theory, heal up to eight clix if he somehow was surrounded by 8 squares of printed blocking, though I’m not sure how that would happen. Seven is more likely.[/COLOR][/B]

GreenMan
I've enjoyed this character in comics back in the 60s and 70s and I am thrilled that we are getting this guy again. He looks very playable and fun. I haven't seen the sculpt in person but I've been told it's kind of small. At least it's not as bad as the original with the flight stand. That was ugly. I'm very disappointed that there wasn't a Diablo made that would work well with DM or independently of DM. I feel like it was a lost opportunity. What are you gonna do? Thanks for Dragon Man, Wizkids. I'll take it.

It's been a long time since I looked at the old Dragon Man. I forgot he was 10 points MORE than this new one! Crazy when you compare the two. I actually like the full dial here, but most likely will play him at 75 with more buddies. With your +4 map roll try to get a map with lots of blocking terrain!
